main event: A witness observed an unidentified aerial object near Newport, Oregon in 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared elliptical in shape and was light bluish-white in color.
It moved at a high speed, approximately twice as fast as an F-102 aircraft, and covered a horizontal distance of 5 miles.
The witness, a school teacher, was considered a reliable observer.
The object made abrupt 90-degree turns, eliminating the possibility of it being a known aircraft.
There was no explanation offered for the cause of the sighting.
